intro: Pilosella asperula, commonly known as rough pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, often growing in full sun. Pilosella asperula is a perennial herb that is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of the Pacific Northwest.
